intro: Strychnos meughe, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
